skill.name: flow-debugging
skill.description: 4-phase systematic debugging for flow-fix. NO FIXES WITHOUT ROOT CAUSE INVESTIGATION FIRST.
skill.summary: 4-phase systematic debugging for flow-fix. NO FIXES WITHOUT ROOT CAUSE INVESTIGATION FIRST.
skill.author: Dimon94

security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation skill containing systematic debugging methodology. No executable code, network calls, file system access, or environment variable access detected. The skill provides debugging best practices and templates without any security-relevant capabilities.

content.value_statement: Stop guessing and start debugging systematically. This skill enforces a proven 4-phase debugging process that finds root causes before any fixes are attempted. Reduce debugging time and prevent regressions with methodical investigation.
actual_capabilities: Prevents premature bug fixing without investigation
Integrates with TDD workflow for verified fixes
limitations: Does not execute code or perform automated debugging
Requires manual implementation of investigation steps
No integration with external debugging tools

use_cases.title: Fix complex bugs methodically
use_cases.description: Apply systematic 4-phase debugging to find root causes of elusive bugs before implementing fixes

use_cases.title: Debug production issues
use_cases.description: Use structured investigation approach to diagnose production failures without introducing new problems

use_cases.title: Learn professional debugging
use_cases.description: Develop systematic debugging habits and avoid common pitfalls like trial-and-error fixing

prompt_templates.title: Start debugging session
prompt_templates.scenario: New bug reported, need systematic approach
prompt_templates.prompt: Use flow-debugging methodology to investigate this bug: [describe bug]. Start with Phase 1 root cause investigation.

prompt_templates.title: Stuck after 3 failed fixes
prompt_templates.prompt: I've tried 3 different fixes and none worked. Apply flow-debugging Phase 3 to stop guessing and form a testable hypothesis.

prompt_templates.title: Verify fix with TDD
prompt_templates.scenario: Found root cause, need to implement fix
prompt_templates.prompt: I've completed root cause investigation. Use flow-debugging Phase 4 to implement the fix with TDD approach.

prompt_templates.title: Debug output documentation
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a debug output report following the flow-debugging template for bug #[ID] with all 4 phases documented.

output_examples.input: Application crashes when user uploads large files
output: Phase 1: Root cause investigation shows error occurs in file validation
Phase 2: Pattern analysis reveals only affects files >10MB
Phase 3: Hypothesis - memory limit exceeded during validation
Phase 4: TDD fix implemented with test for 15MB file upload

best_practices: Always complete Phase 1 investigation before attempting any fixes
Document each phase thoroughly for future reference and team knowledge
Stop after 3 failed fix attempts and re-examine root cause hypothesis
anti_patterns: Never skip root cause investigation and jump directly to fixing
Avoid 'trying this and that' without forming testable hypotheses
Don't consider a bug fixed without automated tests verifying the fix

faq.question: Is this compatible with existing debugging tools?
faq.answer: Yes, flow-debugging is methodology that complements tools like debuggers, profilers, and log analyzers by providing systematic process.

faq.question: What are the limits of this debugging approach?
faq.answer: Methodology requires time for thorough investigation and works best for complex bugs where root cause isn't immediately obvious.

faq.question: How does this integrate with development workflows?
faq.answer: Integrates with CC-DevFlow's /flow-fix command and enforces TDD practices for verified bug fixes.

faq.question: Is my debugging data safe?
faq.answer: Skill is documentation-only with no data collection, network calls, or external communication - all investigation stays local.

faq.question: What if I can't reproduce the bug?
faq.answer: Phase 1 emphasizes gathering more information until stable reproduction is achieved - don't proceed without it.

faq.question: How does this compare to trial-and-error debugging?
faq.answer: Systematic approach prevents regressions and reduces overall debugging time by ensuring correct fix the first time.
